pr_title: [NETBEANS-4881] Automatically detect & list Payara Platform version in the server registration panel

timeline.message: Automatically detect & list Payara Server version from Apache NetBeans IDE
NETBEANS-4881 Automatically list Payara Micro version

timeline.bodyText: Is this an unnecessary change just adding empty space at the end of the line?
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -503,7 +503,7 @@ meth public final void setName(java.lang.String)
 meth public final void setPriority(int)
 meth public final void stop()
  anno 0 java.lang.Deprecated()
-meth public final void stop(java.lang.Throwable)
+meth public final void stop(java.lang.Throwable)

timeline.bodyText:
Changing enum to normal class? That is binary incompatible change. Now there are two options:

do the change in a compatible way
properly document/label/version an incompatible change

In case you want to evolve enum to non-enum in a compatible way, read this essay. It can be done, but just changing to class ServerDetails isn't the right approach.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1490,48 +1490,11 @@ meth public org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.TaskState call2()
 supr org.netbeans.modules.payara.common.BasicTask<org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.TaskState>
 hfds LOGGER,RESTART_DELAY,support
 
-CLSS public final !enum org.netbeans.modules.payara.common.ServerDetails

timeline.bodyText: Removing a field from an API is probably completely unnecessary. Rather mark as @Deprecated.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:

 fld public final static java.lang.String PROP_GROUP_ID = "groupId"
-fld public final static java.lang.String PROP_JAVA_EE_VERSION = "javaeeVersion"

timeline.bodyText: Another attempt to change an enum to something extensible. See again.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1398,34 +1398,9 @@ meth public abstract org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling.TaskEvent getEvent()

timeline.bodyText: Removing from list of friends is an incompatible API change.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -71,7 +80,7 @@
                 </test-type>
             </test-dependencies>
             <friend-packages>
-                <friend>org.netbeans.modules.payara.cloud</friend>
+                <friend>org.netbeans.modules.payara.micro</friend>

replies.bodyText: Payara Modules are originally forked from GlassFish modules, org.netbeans.modules.payara.cloud listing is caused by replacing org.netbeans.modules.glassfish -> org.netbeans.modules.payara package, which actually does not exist, so removed it.
replies.author: jGauravGupta

timeline.bodyText:
To keep compatibility one would have to:

keep the public enum PayaraVersion
make it implement Comparable
Introduce new (package private) class PayaraVersionImproved
extract common functionality into interface PayaraVersionApi
make both enum and "improved" class implement the API interface
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach

timeline.bodyText: Expanding list of friends, constitutes an API change and has to be properly versioned. See friend dependencies essay.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -169,6 +169,7 @@
                 <friend>org.netbeans.modules.android.maven</friend>
                 <!-- danis@netbeans.org -->
                 <friend>org.vaadin.netbeans.maven</friend>
+                <friend>org.netbeans.modules.payara.tooling</friend>

timeline.message: Merge branch 'FISH-253' of https://github.com/jGauravGupta/netbeans into FISH-253
[NETBEANS-4881] PayaraVersion & ServerDetails enum compatible API added

timeline.bodyText:
Alas, to be binary backward compatible, you have to keep the old method signature and introduce new method:
PayaraPlatformVersionAPI getVersionApi()

You can choose the method name, of course. Technically it would even be getVersion(), but you are going to have problems to compile Java source that contains two methods without arguments with different return types.
timeline.author: JaroslavTulach
timeline.diffHunk:

timeline.message: [NETBEANS-4881] Set the HTTP based Admin Interface
[NETBEANS-4881] Payara Tooling compatible API added in signature
